alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Jasper; Tyler (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 09 at 2:57AM CST until January 09 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lake Charles has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Tyler County in southeastern Texas... Northwestern Hardin County in southeastern Texas... Northwestern Jasper County in southeastern Texas... * Until 600 AM CST. * At 257 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. several inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flooding include... Woodville, Colmesneil, Saratoga, Ebenezer, Rockland, Wildwood, Warren, Town Bluff, Thicket, Votaw, Honey Island, Spurger, Batson, Village Mills, Ivanhoe, Sam Rayburn Dam and Hillister. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
